intro: Mesembryanthemum dentatum, commonly known as the "Cape marigold," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid environments. Its flowers bloom in the morning and close by midday, a trait known as nyctinasty. Mesembryanthemum dentatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
